author: Daemon Capital
title: DEX, Cardano Decentralized Exchange
description: Blockchain-agnostic decentralized exchange with liquidity staking and farming, crypto indexes, derivatives, mirrored assets, and daemons.

assessments.note: In-depth explanation of a DEX, something that I deem necessary for furthering the Cardano ecosystem and driving adoption.
DEXes are center pieces of a blockchain-based economy.

Decentralized finance has shown to be in high demand for those adopting cryptocurrency.  I think it is important that Cardano develops DApps in this space so that it can function in interoperability with other blockchains.

I give a 5 for impact because the proposal aims to bring an enormous, possibly incalculable, amount of value to users. This proposal is a platform for advanced trading of cryptocurrencies, including exchanges, index investments, derivatives, and mirrored investments. Not only would this application bring value to users of this application, it would bring value to the entire cryptocurrency community. The most important objective, for me when reading the proposal, is the one to increase market efficiencies by allowing traders to short a currency. This is based on accurate financial principals and is critical to lessen volatility in crypto markets. This helps the currencies themselves and anyone who holds or seeks to hold the currency. This will help bring cryptos into more common use because there won't be huge price swings.
Detailed proposal, though no clear it as a DApp/integration. It is an exchange which will trade all manner of cryptocurrencies.
they sure have a lot written out in the proposal, yes they seem to cover how they will address the proposed challenge.
This is a complete dApp challenge proposal to build a multi-feature DEX on Cardano
There is a need for a DEX to enable Defi services in the Cardano blockchain. This is likely to improve liquidity and encourage market participants to utilise Cardano.
The Dapp integrates the Cardano ecosystem with other protocols.

To effectively bring more user engagement and increased adoption of cardano blockchain offering all form of financial services through decentralized exchange, the proposals effectively contributes these goals.

The broad vision and clearly articulated elements of the solution are impressive.  This could bring great value and many users to the Cardano ecosystem.

Including a specific focus on education and communication will be a great source of value.

The anonymous nature of the proposal has limited this ranking, as trust is important for an exchange and the value it can generate.

The proposal could be improved with more clarity around the operational aspects of the exchange (fees, tokenomics).
Not a lot information about the team. The registration date and contribution by the sole Gitlab organization member does not convey confidence.
The proposed plan to host various financial products is very ambitious. The proposer seems to be optimistic and confident.
the anonymity choice of the team make it impossible to judge their credentials this is why the notations is average , will see but the fund asked is not much so "why not"

I appreciate the honesty from the proposer(s) that this is something hard to gauge in terms of scope, budget and also the security concerns.  I believe this shows they are aware of the complexity and not being naive. I think this will need to be a integration that will need various rounds of funding to fully mature, but that what has been proposed is possible considering a few working examples already exist. I think Cardano could solve some of the existing shortcomings and would help drive adoption and attract further innovation.

I give a 4 for feasibility because it is a large scale, complex application. The proposers demonstrate their knowledge of both finance and coding within the proposal. The budget is reasonable and they provide specific time bound measures of success over the next year. The item that prevents me from giving a 5 in feasibility is concern about how the DEX will handle short trades. What country's regulations will you use - if any - for margin requirements? When will a margin call happen? There are many complexities to this type of trade so I am concerned about its implementation.
Whilst I appreciate the proposers comments around anonymity, this is a very complex project and without more info on who they are it is hard so say they have the ability to pull it off.

I'm not so sure of this, i see a lot of content here but not so much about history and skillset of the team. I didn't see any info on the team. They seem to cover pretty well various outside aspects like marketing, regulation avoidance, and governance.
the content included in this proposal from metrics to roadmap to overview on AMM's is thorough.

The proposers are citing reasons for the lack of a legal regulatory mechanism for remaining anonymous to safeguard their own interest. This gives no option to evaluate the proposer's capability. The requirement of escrow services to verify the identity and capability is not suitable for the catalyst proposal.
The team is anonymous, but the depth of detail in the proposal shows a deep understanding of the crypto world.
From the great presentation and well articulated, the proposers surely have experience and capacity to deliver this proposal.

The request for funding is well-categorized and quite reasonable, but the timeframe the investment will support is unclear.

Similarly, the "definition of success" provides a great framework for implementation and delivery planning, but does not link directly to the funding so it's difficult to measure progress and success.

This is a great approach but needs to be more specific and realistic about delivery milestones for initial phases in order to be able to judge success.  This would be helpful particularly given the very broad and complex nature of the functionality described in the vision.

The information provided does not give any indication whether the $50k would be enough to implement the challenge to the point that this project is self-sustaining and will already have a significant amount of users. The scope is quite large and the realization of all of this seems with the given self-imposed constraints and presented information is unrealistic as per my assessment.
The proposed project seems to be at the initial research and exploration stage, which poses relatively high risk and potentially high reward.

The scope of this proposal is large to say the least.  I feel like enough detail is provided, but that the upfront funding is justified to help develop a first Iteration that then could be evolved through consensus.
I give a 4 for KPIs because they list the metrics but not their targets for each metric. The time horizon is clear and reasonable. The solution to the problem they outline is clear.

It is a detailed proposal. It is not clear how it addresses the challenge. More detail on exatly how if differs (and improves upon) other centralised and decentralised options out there would be useful. Ie why is this needed.?
they did, they also have a far out timeline for completion.
The team has deep experience in market making and has submitted a complete DEX proposal that directly addresses the challenge.

The proposal claims that the output can be considered to assessing the team's capability during an audit, even for open source code that operates on implicit trust. There is a need to audit the code before the community accepts it. Software backdoors and other related threats are detrimental to the Cardano ecosystem.
There is a thorough breakdown of the budget and timetables that would allow for the tracking of the progress.
In my opinion,  information given is a enough to assess the success of of the project.

As mentioned above, the delivery milestones outlined in the "definition of success" are a great starting point for a delivery plan.  It is unclear how these goals relate to the technical delivery elements of the "Roadmap".

The proposal could be more clearly measurable and auditable with more specific and more focused milestones.  The vision is broad and powerful, but will encompass more time and effort to realize than is outlined.  The resources don't clearly match expected outcomes as they are currently described, which reduces confidence in proposal success.  

One way of addressing this could be to focus on the first 12 months with a clear outline of the functionality to be delivered in each phase.

solution: Liquidity, index, derivatives, mirrored assets, smart contracts, cutting edge stack (React.js UI, Haskell backend, GraphQL API, Kubernetes).
experience: Advanced degrees in Informatics, Quantitive Finance. Front-office leadership roles in top #1 market makers and banks. To the max cyberpunks.
